content.description: Great beginner route next to a great beginner trad line on solid sandstone. Morning sun during the winter and somewhat sheltered from the wind. Great shade during the summer, just pick dry weather.
content.location: Located just left of the obvious angled crack. Start below the first bolt.

content.description: Bouldery crux start, just below roof, transitions up and left into crack and left facing dihedral. Suck up pro and has a bomber two bolt rap chain. rap anchors are just above a beginner sport line called 'V Card'.
content.protection: Small to large rack, top anchors provided
content.location: Located on public lands, in the Mark twain National Forest, just down hill off the east side of Devil's Back Bone Road, several hundered feet before the top of the hill turn around point. Ask a local, then enjoy the climb.

content.description: Crux is gaining the lip and then pulling the lip. Work the bouldering optioins to gain the roof lip then pull up to a fist jam, utilize a left knee bar, then work the slopers with the right. Plug in a fist sized cam to protect your continuation on much easier climbing.
content.protection: Take hand to fist sized cams, ask for spotters, and spread a few bouldering pads.

content.description: 40 ft tall quality, brown sandstone with a main crack feature and a mix of slab and overhanging climbs. Shaded and east facing, so it tends to get morning sun in the winter.
